item.description:
Manhattan Short Film Festival

Connecticut film lovers will have the opportunity to unite with cineastes all over the world by viewing and voting on the short works of international filmmakers during the 14th Annual Manhattan Short Film Festival. Audiences at each venue are asked to vote for the one film they think should win. Votes are sent to MANHATTAN SHORT headquarters in NYC where the winner is announced. More than 100,000 people worldwide are expected to participate. For this year’s lineup of shorts, visit the festival website. 120 min.

UPDATE:  There are ten finlms that we will see:  http://msfilmfest.com/finalists.html

The Thursday screening will be free with admission to Art After Hours.   On the first Thursday of each month the museum is open from 5 – 8 pm for cocktails, appetizers, art activities, music and a film!  Free for members, $5 for students or $10 regular admission.

 

The films are also being screened on Friday at 7:00pm and Sunday at 2:00pm.   Additional information for these showings is on the museum's website:  http://www.thewadsworth.org/events/category/film/upcoming/

General Admission: $9, Seniors (62+) and Students w/i.d.: $8, Members: $7

Film Buff: $3.50, Film Stars and Insider Access Members and above: Free.
item.how_to_find_us: I will meet people at one of the tables in the Aetna Theatre lobby around 7:40pm. I'm a short brunette with artsy glasses and I'll be wearing a black top and print skirt.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: Manhattan Shorts Film Festival - Art After Hours
